project_abstract.cdata: The project aims to correct the most critical defects in the power sector. The project consists of the following components : (i) the rehabilitation of Sotuba hydroelectric plant; repairs to and a major overhaul of the Selingue hydro plant; the extension of Dar Salam diesel station; the installation of five new diesel plants; and the rehabilitation of four existing diesel plants; (ii) the construction of a 230 km, single circuit, 150 kV transmission line, substations and associated voltage control equipment; and (iii) the rehabilitation of the distribution system in downtown Bamako and the construction of about 475 km of medium and low voltage lines and substations in unelectrified sections of Bamako. The project will also provide consultant services and technical assistance for construction supervision and the preparation of a variety of feasibility, tariff and efficiency studies. A household energy strategy component will be implemented following the completion of an ongoing household energy study.
